Welcome to the Power Platform Hub

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Accelerate innovation and amplify your productivity with Power Platform

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Microsoft Power Platform delivers fundamental technology benefits that can improve business agility and productivity and reduce costs. In our organization, we're adopting low-code to accelerate digital innovation and transformation.

You're already an expert in your business; Microsoft Power Platform gives you the tools to take that expertise and solve business problems with automation and apps tailored for your organizations.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Hackathons

A hackathon is a fun way to engage lots of people within your organization around a digital culture of change. The key objective is to develop sample apps and cultivate ideas to drive digital transformation. Teams come together, at the line of business or at the global scale, from different roles and departments to compete and create apps that address an organizational need.

If your team is looking to organize a hackathon, check out the Hackathon Planning Workbook.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
What are we hacking?

Research and innovation are focusing on our field inspection capabilities. Aiming to increase the number of inspections, reduce the risk to employees and use the power of AI to better predict maintenance issues, putting {parameter:CompanyName} at the forefront of the industry.

We welcome you to our hack, bring ideas, enthusiasm and help us put together the next amazing Power App!

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Our challenges

Currently inspections are managed by manual processes.  Inspectors have to inspect towers, requiring specialist climbing equipment and training.

An inspector can realistically complete two tower inspections per day. We want to use the Power Platform and AI to create something that can increase the number of tower inspections per day, remove the climbing gear, and improve the accuracy of our maintenance predictions.

How long is the hack?

We are aiming for a weeklong hackathon, resulting in a number of Proof-of-Concept apps.  

How can you get involved?


If you have a flair for interfaces, a passion for data or are a fan of AI then we want your help!  Come along and help {parameter:CompanyName} become industry leaders in predictive maintenance.

The event will hybrid.  If you are located in the HQ offices, or plan to attend remotely, we will be breaking the hackathon into three teams:​​​​​​​

TeamFocus area
Team AData and insights
Team BIntegration
Team CUser interface and experience

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Got an idea but no time to turn into reality yourself?​​​​​​​ Our Development Studio Team can help you solve business challenges with Power Platform.

The Development Studio is part of our Power Platform Center of Excellence – they can bring projects through any and every stage of development – from envisioning to experience design to incubation to Pro Dev and support. Engaging Development Studio is simple – you bring us a problem, we bring you a proposal, you say go, we build your solution.

Communities internal to the Company where you can collaborate or ask questions about the Power Platform.

  • ​Check out the Power Platform Community! Power Makers gather here to connect, ask questions, and learn from each other.​
  • Ask a question on the Power Platform Yammer forum. Novices, professionals, and people from the product group come together to discuss all things Power Apps here.​

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Power Platform is made up of many environments. Each environment can contain Power Apps applications, Power Automate flows, Power Pages, a Dataverse database and many other types of resource​s.

< Company tenant graphic explaining the DLP policies associated with each Shared Environment and Custom Environments. We can provide an example like the below>




The Company tenant has been configured so you can quickly create powerful productivity solutions and share them with your colleagues.

Your responsibilities in the Company tenant:​​​​​​​

  • Keep the tenant clean. Delete your environments, apps, and flows if they are no longer needed. If you want to keep unused apps and flows as a reference, make sure they are no longer shared with anyone.
  • Share wisely. Watch out for oversharing of your environments, apps, flows, and shared connections​. Read the section on Resource Sharing to understand how to do this properly.
  • Protect Company data. Avoid moving data from highly confidential or confidential data sources to non-protected or external storage.
  • You are responsible for sensitive Company data. If your Power Platform resources use Confidential or Highly Confidential data, then you are responsible for the handling of that data in accordance with Company Security Policy and Standards.

Environments are containers for resources (like apps and flows) in the Power Platform. Think of an environment like a Windows folder, used for grouping and securing your resources. When you sign in at make.powerapps.com or make.powerautomate.com, you’ll see one or more environments in the dropdown list at the upper right. When you select an environment, you’ll be able to see the apps, flows, and other resources that have been shared with you. And, if you are an Environment Maker​, you’ll be able to create your own resources.

Purpose of Environments

Environments are useful for several purposes:

  • Access control – An administrator of an environment can limit who can create resources like apps or flows in an environment.
  • Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) – It can be beneficial to have preproduction and production environments. Makers can develop and test in the pre-production environment and export a package, called a Solution, to the production environment.
  • Compliance – In some cases, you need to isolate data or the solution so others can’t gain access to it – especially when you’re working with confidential data.
  • Connector risk reduction –Power Platform uses connectors to access data from services. An administrator can define which connectors are allowed in which environment through Data Loss Prevention (DLP) policies. In this way, access to more advanced connectors can be constrained to approved environments.

Environments

At our Company we have many environments. Some Shared Environments have already been provisioned and are a great place to quickly get your solutions up and running. For teams that have more specialized requirements, Custom Environments can be provisioned with Dataverse​​, Dynamics 365, and custom DLP policies.

Look through these sections to learn about our Power Platform environments and how you can use them:

Personal Productivity (Default)​​​

This is the default environment. Everyone has permissions to create apps and flows here. This is also the environment that is used for first party integrations, like creating an app from a SharePoint list.

To reduce risk to our data, we limit the types of connectors you can use in your apps and flows to the Personal Productivity Policy. This policy covers common individual and small team productivity scenarios, like working with SharePoint data, sending emails, and having an approval workflow.​ If you need more powerful connectors, please read the following sections to find the right environment for you.

To begin, simply go to make.powerapps.com and sign in with your company credentials. On your first visit you’ll automatically be in the Personal Productivity environment.

Power User

While the Personal Productivity environment covers many use cases, we understand that some power users will have more advanced needs for their apps and flows.

For this purpose, we’ve created the Power User environment. This shared environment uses the Power User Policy which enables many more connectors.

Some considerations for the Power User environment:

  • Please review the available connectors in this environment to make sure it’s the right fit for your app and flow needs.
  • Once you’ve gained access to the environment, you’ll have Environment Maker permissions. This will give you the permission to create new resources, like apps and flows, and some shared connectors.
  • Resources you’ve created can be shared with others, but please be careful to not overshare. Gaining access to the Power User environment

By requesting access to this environment, you will attest that you've read the materials in this document and understand how to safely create and share your apps and flows. <Insert company process on how to request access>

Custom Environments

While the default and shared environments in the company tenant cover many use cases for productivity scenarios, teams may benefit from creating custom environments for business important and mission critical solutions they’re building. See the Purpose of Environments​ section for some common reasons why a team or organization may require a separate environment where you can exercise greater control.

Some considerations for custom environments:

  • By default, a new environment will be provisioned with the Productivity Policy. If more connectors are required, you can request a Custom Policy by submitting a request here <insert company process on how to request a custom policy>
  • The requestor will be a System Administrator in the new environment. The administrator has full control to manage resources and user access. It will be your responsibility to manage access control wisely.
  • If an environment is no longer needed, delete it!

<COMPANY SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS ON REQUESTING A NEW ENVIRONMENT> If you do not have a process today, evaluate using the Environment Request Management process of the CoE starter kit

Dataverse for Teams environments

​Microsoft Dataverse for Teams is a built-in, low-code data platform for Microsoft Teams that empowers users to build custom apps, bots, and flows in Microsoft Teams by using Power Apps, Power Virtual Agents, and Power Automate. With this capability, you can now create a new Power Platform environment with a lightweight Dataverse database and link it to the team.

Learn more: Microsoft Dataverse for Teams overview

Developer environments

​You can sign up for a free developer environment to develop and test apps, including support for premium and custom connectors, Dataverse, and additional developer environments. The Power Apps Developer Plan is restricted to building and testing apps to validate prior to production and not meant to host production apps. It’s a great environment for your personal learning and upskilling

Learn more: Power Apps Developer Plan

Deleting unused environments

Help us keep our tenant clean and free of unused environments. If an environment is no longer needed, please delete it.

Learn more: Delete an environment in Power Platform admin center

A Data Loss Prevention (DLP) Policy is created by a Power Platform administrator to protect information security and data in the tenant. A DLP policy allows an administrator to enforce which connectors are enabled for each environment.

In our company, several pre-approved policies have been created and are available for our shared environments and can be enabled for custom environments. Those policies are:

  • Personal Productivity Policy, used in Personal Productivity and any new environments
  • Power User Policy, used in the Power User environment
  • Custom Policy, used for custom environments

New connectors are available periodically and will be added to our shared policies as appropriate. Custom policies are also available on request. If you would like a custom policy or would like a connector to be evaluated for an existing policy, please <COMPANY SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS ON REQUESTING A NEW DLP policy> If you do not have a process today, evaluate using the DLP Request Management process of the CoE starter kit

Standard DLP Policies

Personal Productivity Policy

The Productivity Policy contains Microsoft first party connectors that have been evaluated and enabled as the default policy for the Personal Productivity, Developer and Dataverse for Teams environments. With this policy you'll be able to accomplish business productivity tasks, like connecting to SharePoint, Office 365, OneDrive for Business, create an approval workflow, and send email. Any custom environments that are created will be configured with this policy by default but can be changed once the environment is created.​

Power User Policy

The Power User Policy contains all the connectors of the Productivity Policy and adds several additional connectors that are useful for power users such as connecting to Azure DevOps, SQL and Azure AD. Because these connectors expose more risk to company data, makers must understand and attest to their proper usage before they are permitted to use this policy. This policy is enabled in the Power User shared environment.

Adding New Pre-Built Connectors

​Microsoft Power Platform enables hundreds of connectors to common services and this number grows constantly. ​As new connectors are added to Power Platform, they are not automatically added to our policies. If you wish to have a new connector reviewed, please <COMPANY SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS ON REQUESTING A NEW connector > If you do not have a process today, evaluate using the DLP Request Management process of the CoE starter kit

Adding Custom Connectors

​Custom connectors are allow-listed by API (host) endpoint.

With the use of Custom Connectors​, your Power Apps and Power Automate Flows can communicate with many more services. Custom connectors need to be added to a DLP policy to work with your apps and flows. Generally, these would be added to a custom policy in a custom environment, but in special cases where there is a broad need for the connector, we can add it to one of our shared policies like Power User. Please <COMPANY SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS ON REQUESTING A NEW custom connector> If you do not have a process today, evaluate using the DLP Request Management process of the CoE starter kit​​​​​​​

Custom Policies

If you create a Custom Environment, it will default to using the Personal Productivity policy.

In some cases, you may require a connector not in one of the pre-approved DLP policies. Please <COMPANY SPECIFIC INSTRUCTIONS ON REQUESTING A NEW custom policy> If you do not have a process today, evaluate using the DLP Request Management process of the CoE starter kit

Your apps, flows, connections, and other resources are contained in an environment. If you need to move your resources from one environment to another, like moving an app and its flows from Personal Productivity (default) to Power User, you will use solutions.

A solution is a container for apps, flows, connections, Dataverse elements, and more. It's a great way to manage more complex applications where Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) is required, like developing in a pre-production environment and deploying the solution to production. It's also a handy way to migrate your solution from one environment to another. Learn more: Application lifecycle management (ALM) with Microsoft Power Platform

If you need a license for Dynamics 365, Power Platform or another Microsoft product, you can request a license as a Company employee for internal use.

<COMPANY PROCESS FOR REQUESTING LICENSES>

Welcome to the Power Platform Hub. 

We have created a SharePoint site to get you started on your journey with the Power Platform. On this site, you can find the following content:


  • Help & Learning - This section will provide links to valuable learning resources like guided learning, internal communities, and support.
  • Power Platform at {parameter:CompanyName} - In this section, you will find information about how {parameter:CompanyName} has implemented the Power Platform. Information about Environments, Data Loss Prevention, how to request a license... it's all there!
  • News & Success Stories - The news & success stories will contain news about the Power Platform, success stories, and will show the champions of the week.
  • Events - In the events section you can view the old Office Hours recording, see when the next one is planned or find a Hackathon that's starting soon.
